Course Description: COMPREHENSIVE EXAMINATION OF THE AUDITORS FUNCTION AND RESPONSIBILITY, INCLUDING PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS OF ETHICS, PROCEDURES, PROGRAMS, AND REPORTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, STUDENTS WHO COMPLETED ALL ASSIGNMENTS AND PARTICIPATED IN CLASS AND GROUP DISCUSSIONS SHOULD BE ABLE TO:
DISCUSS THE OVERVIEW OF AUDITING AS A PROFESSION AND THE QUALITY FACTORS TO AN AUDIT.
DESCRIBE THE FRAUD TRIANGLE AND SARBANES-OXLEY (SOX).
DESCRIBE THE REASONS FOR THE IMPORTANCE OF INTERNAL CONTROL.
UNDERSTAND THE LAW AND LEGAL ACTIONS FROM AUDITS.
PREPARE THE TYPE AND TIMING OF AUDIT PROCEDURES
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
